fields.description:
It seems that platform is not being reported properly with euca-describe-instances. 

This is affecting Hybridfox and possibly Rightscale and their compatibility with Euca 3.1 as they relate to Windows instances (neither are officially compatible yet). 

Without detecting an instance as Windows, they assume the instance is a Linux variant and do not offer the ability to retrieve the Windows admin password through their interfaces.
fields.summary: euca-describe-instances doesn't seem to be reporting platform
fields.environment:
Centos 6.3 
2xDell R410 w/16GB RAM + 1TB RAID1
CLC/CC/SC/S3 on Server #1, NC on Server #2
Managed network mode

comments.body: Confirmed. This holds true for both EBS-backed and instance-store backed instances. *Steps to reproduce* 1. Register EBS-backed and instance-store backed images. Example is as follows: {code} # euca-describe-images | grep windows IMAGE emi-C7B54556 345590850920/windows-server2003r2_ent_x64 345590850920 available public x86_64 machine ebs IMAGE emi-F61536F3 windows2003r2_x64/windowsserver2003r2_ent_x64.kvm.img.manifest.xml 345590850920 available public i386 machine windows instance-store {code} 2. Launch EBS-backed and instance-backed instances. 3. Run euca-describe-instances for both instances. Example is as follows: *EBS-backed* {code} # euca-describe-instances i-3B403E4F --debug 2012-08-24 20:02:55,460 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Method: POST 2012-08-24 20:02:55,460 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Path: Information* - http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/CommandLineReference/ApiReference-cmd-DescribeInstances.html ..... platform The platform. Use windows if you have Windows based instances; otherwise, leave blank. Type: String Valid value: windows ...... - http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeInstances.html .... platform The platform. Use windows if you have Windows based instances; otherwise, leave blank. Type: String Valid value: windows ......

In Eucalyptus, we've used the prefix of "windows" on the manifest name to detect windows images. It's not great, but it's what we have. Our user console will work with this in 3.2.
Now, instances we know to be windows will return the platform field as "windows" in the describe instances response. For linux, that field is blank (and I think we have an issue filed for that because in our own console development we flagged that as a problem).

David, the bug here is that the platform isn't actually getting reported for Windows instances.  Not returning a platform for non-Windows instances is correct, and the management console code needs to be able to deal with that.

Yep, tried against 3.1.1 and don't see "platform" in the DescribeInstanceResponse.

http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeInstances.html

Oops, too soon.

Garrett is accurate.

"Use windows if you have Windows based instances; otherwise, leave blank."
This still needs testing/fixing.  Specifically, we should ensure that the CLC reports {{windows}} platforms for Windows instances.
This appears to hamper 3rd party tool integration.  Is this a documented workaround or are there changes to make in Eucalyptus?   [~gholms] and [~neil] please respond.
Evaluating fix for 3.4.1, will remove from release if too complex.
The code appears to put "windows" as the platform for windows images, which seems to be the intent, so looks good.

Fix verified. Windows instances report the platform type as "windows" otherwise there is no platform in the response.
